definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)

sentences.english: Did you come to London to see your family or for business purposes?
sentences.chinese: 你來倫敦是看望家人還是公幹？

sentences.english: Please be advised that I will have a five-day business trip to Chicago effective from today night.
sentences.chinese: 特此通知，小弟將於今晚乘機遠赴芝加哥公幹五天。

sentences.english: I generally try to take in a show when I'm in New York on business.
sentences.chinese: 我到紐約公幹時常順便看場演出。

sentences.english: The head office is considering sending you to London on important meeting.
sentences.chinese: 倫敦有重要公幹，總公司正在考慮派你去。

sentences.english: When I went on business to Peru , the office refunded my expenses.
sentences.chinese: 我在祕魯公幹時，公司給我報銷花費。

sentences.english: Honesty is the ideal business or tourist accommodation.
sentences.chinese: 誠屬公幹或旅遊的理想住宿選擇。

definition: to take the opportunity/to take a plane
to go on a tour/to have an outing
special (or reserved) train (or bus etc)/limousine/private car used as a taxi and booked via a smartphone app
to ride (in a car or carriage)/to drive/to motor
